intro: Sideritis hyssopifolia f. corbariensis, commonly known as the Corbières sainfoin, is a rare subspecies native to the south of France. It is a low-growing perennial herb with hairy, slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with silver, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological characteristics.
